about.label: Our data explained
about.blurb: Gauges show readings of tryptophan-like-fluorescence (TLF) in parts per billion of tryptophan, taken every 15 minutes by sensors in the water. TLF is a promising indicator of how many microbes are present. Higher readings mean more tryptophan was detected and that water quality is likely poorer

headline: Tryptophan levels in the three Chicago river branches
